H0.text: The distance between the vibration source and the receiver determines the speed at which sound waves travel.

H1.text: Type of material through which the sound travels is the factor on which the speed at which sound waves travel depends.

H2.text: Size of the object making the sound is the factor that determines the speed at which sound waves travel.

H3.text: The type of device making the sound is the factor that determines the speed at which sound waves travel.

A4.text: The speed of sound is variable and depends on the properties of the substance through which the wave is travelling.

A5.text: The speed of sound in an ideal gas depends only on its temperature and composition.
